answers.answer: Thyroid symptoms are so non-specific.  In other words, a lot of other health conditions have the same symptoms as thyroid, it is very difficult to distinguish where the symptoms are coming from or which health conditions are the cause.  So thyroid conditions are based on TSH level the cascading to other test when warranted. If your TSH level was above 10 or below 0.01 with symptoms, then it would suggest thyroid.Nodules normally are not presented with abnormal thyroid levels, unless nodule is hyper-functioning as in Graves' disease.However, I personal believe your description deserves attention with the proper test. Have you been to an endo. who treats many thyroid patients  per year. Most deal in diabetes and not too much in thyroid, so you need to find one who does.You need your nodules checked out!  Demand your rights!  and good luck.
